title: Mass. snowplow driver who spotted legs sticking out of snowbank praised for saving older man
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts snowplow driver Matte McGarry saved an older man trapped in a snowbank in Auburn during a winter storm.
The man had fallen headfirst into a 3-foot deep snowbank, unable to free himself due to powdery snow conditions.
McGarry is set to receive a commendation from the Auburn Board of Selectmen for his life-saving actions.

title: UMass student suspended after organizing protest sues university
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: UMass Amherst student Kivlighan de Montebello sues university over a one-year suspension for organizing a protest.
The protest targeted RTX, formerly Raytheon, during a campus career fair on September 29, challenging the company's defense contracting.
De Montebello claims his First Amendment rights were violated, seeking damages and suspension expungement through a lawsuit.

title: More details emerge about children charged with murder in R.I.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Four preteens were charged with murder in connection to the fatal Jan. 19 assault of Rony Alonso in Providence.
The juveniles, three aged 12 and one 11, were originally charged with felony assault; the charges were upgraded to murder.
Three suspects were apprehended after allegedly vandalizing a vehicle near the crime scene; the fourth was arrested later.

title: Allandale Farm loses second Highland steer following brother’s death last year
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Curtis, a 16-year-old Highland steer at Allandale Farm in Jamaica Plain, died peacefully in his paddock this week.
Curtis's death follows that of his brother Willard, who passed in March 2025; both were longstanding farm attractions.
Allandale Farm plans a celebration of life for Curtis; the public can share memories and photos on their website.

title: Red Sox have reportedly discussed trading reliever Jordan Hicks in search of an infielder
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox discussed trading reliever Jordan Hicks to acquire an infielder, as reported by The Athletic's Jen McCaffrey.
Brayan Bello and Patrick Sandoval were also mentioned in trade talks; Bello's team-friendly contract makes him appealing.
Red Sox connected to infielders Nico Hoerner, Matt Shaw, Isaac Paredes, and free agent Eugenio Suarez this offseason.

title: Breakout Patriots LB K’Lavon Chaisson wants to re-sign with New England in free agency
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Linebacker K’Lavon Chaisson wants to re-sign with the Patriots after a standout season.
Chaisson recorded 7.5 sacks and 18 quarterback hits during the regular season with New England.
Patriots' offensive and defensive coordinators praised for maximizing Chaisson's performance.

title: Patriots DC Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after four months battling prostate cancer
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots DC Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after battling aggressive prostate cancer since September.
Williams completed five rounds of chemotherapy at Mass General Hospital, responding well to treatment.
Williams will join the Patriots for Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara, marking his first travel since diagnosis.

title: Cambridge becomes first Mass. city to endorse Plant Based Treaty — but what does that mean?
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Cambridge City Council endorses the Plant Based Treaty, becoming the first Massachusetts city to support the global initiative.
The treaty aims to promote sustainable food systems and reduce emissions, complementing the Paris Agreement efforts.
Cambridge now collaborates with activists to implement plant-based food practices and inspire similar actions in other cities.

title: 5 Catherine O’Hara movies and TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Catherine O'Hara, known for 'Schitt's Creek' and 'Home Alone,' died at 71 following a brief illness.
'Schitt's Creek,' featuring O'Hara as Moira Rose, is streaming on Hulu and Prime Video.
'A Mighty Wind' and 'Beetlejuice Beetlejuice' are available on YouTube and HBO Max, respectively.

title: Mike Vrabel doesn’t buy that Patriots’ white uniforms provide good luck: ‘Hope the tooth fairy comes tonight’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel dismisses superstition regarding Patriots' choice to wear white uniforms for Super Bowl LX.
Patriots have a 5-0 record in games wearing white this season and 6-0 last season.
Teams wearing white in Super Bowls have a 37-22 record, though recent trends show mixed results.
